Reviews.Title: Poor Product and Poor Customer Service
Reviews.Author: pabo
Reviews.Content: Funny - the folks at Stem Innovation / iZon are a little thin skinned and deleted my original post about their customer service....so I ultimately got my answer from Chris Doran at iZon. Despite the cameras completely stopping any recording merely 60 days after I spent $264 on 2 cameras, and not having any ability to record for the last 60 days, iZon refuses to stand behind their product. How companies deal with situations like this is what differentiates great companies and products from poor ones. iZon, based on this experience, is a poor one. I would avoid buying any of their products.Amazon may want to pull them and discontinue the relationship.

Reviews.Title: Works OK but leaves room for improvement. (UPDATED)
Reviews.Author: DIGITALid
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:  After spending some time with it I have decided to update my review.  This device quickly became an absolute nightmare when that glitch appeared in their system that kept replicating the cameras. After weeks of going back and forth with support via e-mail I was told the following.1.  You shouldn't have your SSID hidden.2.  You shouldn't have any dashes or underscores in your SSID.3.  You should consider using basic WEP.?!?  Keep in mind that it worked fine just the way it was before their weird back end glitch.  They deleted my account and we restarted from scratch several times.  That device is now a paperweight.  And a bad one at that since it is so tiny.  $130 wasted.  I'm leaving one extra star because I really like that it uploads to YouTube and hope other companies follow suit.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The Good:  The best thing about this device is that it works.  Once you have it up and running it records video and audio.  The motion and audio alarms are a little quirky but they do work.  The YouTube compatibility is a MAJOR PLUS.  All other alternatives are much more expensive.  The camera is surprisingly small and well built.  The magnetic stand is cool and I prefer it to those screw based tilt solutions that loosen after time.The Bad:  The monitoring limitation.  It limits you to 5 minutes at a time when you are viewing remotely which I don't understand.  You tap it again and it starts over.  Perhaps its a heating issue?  Worse part of that is that it rarely works for the full 5 minutes anyway.  It disconnects even when you have 4 or 5 bars seemingly at random.The Ugly:  The setup leaves a lot to be desired.  When you first configure it, the device opens a unsecured wireless hotspot (it doesn't give anyone access to anything but itself) that ANYONE can connect to which is a little unnerving.  If someone recognizes that type of device it isn't beyond the realm of possibility that they could figure out how to connect and then have access to your camera.  I don't know if the camera can be registered on multiple devices.  Once it is set up correctly you can place it on a secured network but its those first few minutes of vulnerability which could be disastrous if you are using this for home security.The Summary:  Some little problems take away from the overall package BUT it really is the BEST solution in this price range right now.  I rarely connect to view for extended periods of time but that YouTube recording makes up for it.  Saving to a private remote account really is the safest bet for home security and for $130 you really can't beat that.  The closest alternative is Dropcam which starts at $200 for video ONLY and NO RECORDING AT ALL.  You can pay $9 a month for 1 week of motion activated backups or $25 for 30 and that really gets expensive very quickly.  iZON does that for free, with audio and for $70 less for the hardware alone!  I only hope they develop a budget outdoor night-vision capable solution soon that is as discreet and easy to use as this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Cool
Reviews.Author: Master "VET"
Reviews.Content: I bought mine directly from Stem at a slight higher price than Amazon. The camera works very well for the price. I have very expensive Axis cameras that are a nightmare to setup - this isn't. You log directly on to the camera's own WIFI to setup then log back into the primary WIFI of your house. Setup a account with Stem and your done. All setup done directly from my iPhone.Cons:video/audio lags about 20 secs.Software locks up on occasion (google "end task on iphone" to restart just the app) *as of 4-5-2012 this is no longer an issue both IOS app and camera firmware (1.3) has resolved issue.Pros:InexpensiveGreat design (especially the magnetic base)Looks coolEasy setup

Reviews.Title: Izon camera
Reviews.Author: traceratops
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good camera, much better than I was expecting after all the bad reviews. It took a little while to set up, but after that it works well. Also, it took awhile to get the remote access to work on my iphone, but after an update to the app it works well now. The picture is good and the motion and sound sensors work well. I really like that it records automatically to youtube when there is motion or sound so I can see what is happening throughout the day. It's everything I was hoping for. Now I can keep an eye on my dogs throughout the day which gives me peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: DOES NOT RECORD VIDEO - LIVE VIDEO LAGS
Reviews.Author: Christopher Haas
Reviews.Content: UPDATE (9-11-12)Stem finally released a record feature through their own servers.  This camera now records video for a maximum of 30 seconds up to 25 videos per day, and deletes the videos after 7 days. That's 12 minutes a day...max.  They still haven't provided a time set feature so this is basically useless.  My hope was to have a camera that could record motion at night when everyone is asleep.  Since this isn't an option, the recordings are all morning time and totally useless.  I am completely dumb founded at what these people are thinking!  Do they actually use their own product, and if so, what for?Bought this at Best Buy, after reading on the box that it has motion triggered video recording and automatic upload to youtube.  What a perfect security camera... Now that I have it unboxed and setup, low and behold: no YouTube upload.  YouTube didn't like the bandwidth demand of this device and no longer allows the upload.  That means this is just a basic webcam with a 20 second delay...yes 20 second delay.  Consider that.  Sit there and count for 20 seconds.  Its completely useless!  Without the ability to record video why would anyone want this?  It should have been taken off of the shelf the day YouTube said "no more".  Instead, they are going to finish selling whats left and close.  PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS NON-WORKING, FALSE ADVERTISING PIECE OF JUNK.  Lame.

Reviews.Title: Great Device. Excellent Price!
Reviews.Author: We Like Mondays "We Like Mondays"
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any trouble with the initial setup (all wifi served over a Time Machine) and used the iPhone and iPad apps from as far away as Australia with no real hiccups.This is perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Wow... Terrible product
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have ever written a 1-star review before, but this product is truly terrible (and a bad value to boot).Pros: cute packaging, interesting mount style, long included cord.Cons:1) amazingly slow-- 30-second plus lag while on the same wifi network.2) very difficult to align to true horizontal.3) absolutely no way to secure it-- all your trust goes through a third party.4) no local viewing option such as a web page or even direct hookup to a computer5) purely a decorative spy camera.6) unreliable-- locked up after a day or two of being powered up.  Could reboot, but not too useful when you are away.7) terrible iPad app, ignoring speed-- portrait only orientation, useless user interface.8) power hog!  It uses something on the order of 10W for a product that should be closer to 2W.  No, won't kill your electric bill, but it makes it clear that this is just intended to be a cute package.Save your money and go for a web-cam instead.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bostone
Reviews.Content: I anxiously awaited delivery of this smart-looking device and was excited when it arrived. I opened it immediately and downloaded the iPhone app. I closely followed the instructions, but despite a dozen attempts I could not get the camera to read the QR Code on my iPhone. I finally decided to call Stem Innovation customer service. Wound up with a recorded message saying that they "were experiencing high caller volume". I left a brief message, my name and phone number and expected a call back. 24 hours later I tried again and got the same recorded message. After another 24 hours I called customer service at exactly 9am EST, the time they open, hoping to beat the "high call volume" queue and again got the recorded message. I waited the rest of the day and that evening went online to begin the return process.Don't be fooled by this Apple-looking device. It is a piece of crap! Stem provides the worst customer service I've ever experienced, particularly for a tech product. Out local DMV's customer service is better. I can only assume that the positive reviews are from Stem employees or stockholders. Anyone thinking of purchasing this product, please do yourself a favor and don't.I only wish I read the reviews before I jumped in.

Reviews.Title: Still not ready for Prime Time
Reviews.Author: AppleTaxi
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this has been a paperweight for the last six months.Waited for the new firmware to arrive and hopefully make it useable.Firmware finally comes BUT I can not install using their intructions.Do a complete reset of the device (twice) and finally get the new firmware installed.Get it set up and wonder of wonders it might work.......except it doesnt!!It is supposed to notify me of an alert and record it if I have that enabled. It did for one day and then stopped. I can't get it to work again.What good is a security device if it doesn't alert you or record!!They tricked me into wasting another 3-4 hours of my time installing firmware, new apps on my phone & ipad , setting up my preferences and after all is done, I still have a paperweight.If you thrive on frustation go for it.

Reviews.Title: It works great!!!
Reviews.Author: NATHAN C. HARDING
Reviews.Content: I works great, just like you would expect an "apple like" device to.  But you need to follow the instructions to set it up.  I realize that others have had troubles but I have found it to be about as simple as could be in set up and usage.  The alerts work as advertised.The only negative is the 20 sec delay in video.  However I was told that there will be a update that will make it near realtime.I did mess up one setup and had trouble reseting the camera but tech support called me, then followed up on it by both phone and email.  Couldn't ask for better customer support.Mine have been up and running for over a month, and I have only had a two problems. which appears to be my router reassigning new ip addresses for devices that have come and gone and then comeback, i.e. multiple devices are trying to use the same IP address.  I think most of the trouble is actually from a bridge router in the network and not the IZON cameras.  I simply unplug the router and the cameras  and plug it back in, it restarts and every thing is working.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly since the new firmware update & app
Reviews.Author: Monte Farber & Amy Zerner
Reviews.Content: You have to disregard the negative ratings of this product - that was then and this is now. I, too, was VERY angry and disappointed when I bought it and it didn't work but crashed and crashed. Since the new firmware update, however, it has worked perfectly and as advertised. Stem's customer service was THE BEST and didn't flinch when I was quite negative about my experience. They told me the firmware update would straighten things out and they were correct. I waited a week and the app and camera are still working perfectly. It is now safe to buy this product.

Reviews.Title: I finally got it working in the Apple time capsule environment...
Reviews.Author: Amir - San Jose, CA
Reviews.Content: I had an extended wireless network with time capsule and two airport expresses. The IZON software did not like that and kept loosing connectivity and kept crashing.I took one airport express and created a new wireless ssid on that in bridge mode and now it is working without much problem. The software still crashes once in a while but tolerable. It seems like IZON was not tested in an extended WiFi network environment.My setup is as follows:Internet----ComcastModem-----TimeCapsule----NetGearEthernetOverPowerLine----AirportExpress (((---))) IZONNote that the airport express is working in bridge mode now with a new WiFi zone.IZON is happy now. I really like the Youtube capture feature. It captures just the right amount of video around the event. I have it on the second floor window facing the street. It does capture whenever a car passes by in front of our house. It works ok at night with street light also.The motion sensor does not seem to be strong enough to trigger on people moving around at that distance.Over all I like the functionality. I wish they can fix issues for an extended WiFi Apple network with Time Capsule and multiple Airport Expresses.I have revised my rating to four star from two. I plan to by one more IZON soon.Following is my original review and the problems I incurred when airport expresses were being used to extend one common WiFi network:It took me 4 hours to configure it and get it working. It would get stuck at the registration screen, where it said that "it will take five minutes to complete...". I thought that may be my wireless network had something wrong. I tried eliminating all variables and it still did not work. After about the tenth try using the exact same process it worked and I liked the fact that you could view video on iPhone from anywhere and that it records directly on Youtube upon sound or motion detection.Pros:- Great concept- Good Hardware design- Magnetic base provides flexibility to adjust direction up/down and sidewaysCons- iPhone application crashes all the time- App automatically logs you out once in a while. When you log back in, another instance of the camera is created. My screen had the same camera listed four times- After a couple of hours the camera cannot be reached and needs to be reset- Close to 30 second delay between the event vs. when the it is displayed on the iPhoneOver all too many problems for a production device. Seems like Stem put it out after alpha testing. If they fix software and application issues, I may give it a try again.

Reviews.Title: IZON
Reviews.Author: John Hashimoto "amiesdad"
Reviews.Content: It is a good idea and the price is good but it is hard to get it set up.  It has gone offline three times now and it takes an effort to get it back up and going again.  All in all it has been offline more than it has been used.  I called customer assistance and left a message but they don't return calls I guess.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup, fun to use, good price
Reviews.Author: Sher
Reviews.Content: This camera works great!  We use it on our back patio and it records any movement to our YouTube account.It was easy to setup, and it is small enough not to be easily detected.  Will be buying a second one soon.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ITEM
Reviews.Author: tlkflat
Reviews.Content: Item looks good on paper and apparently a few of the actually work. If yours does not work as mine did, customer service is nice, however completely clueless. (If you don't mind waiting on hold forever) was told they would send me a replacement unit, a week later I called back only to be told they would not send me a new unit until the got my old unit back. ( different story than when the first person said they would send a tested unit and then send my unit back) Like a lot of the young companies, good idea, no customer service and will be one of the start up's that will wonder what happened when they close the doors.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and can always say goodnight to my family.  My wife just had our 2nd child and I can see him from the road. I only with there was night vision

Reviews.Title: Tips to making this work
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: First things first, you HAVE to have WPA security on your WiFi network. I spent a day trying to make this work on WEP, no dice. As soon as you convert to WPA this should find the camera and immediately try to update the Firmware to 2.0. This update is going to take a little while so let it continue. Once updated this will work fine. I think the frustration people have been having with the setup being incomplete is the same as I had. Changing to WPA on your router seemed to be the answer for me. I have been using the camera at home for two months now and I get a great picture with good functionality from the app on my iPhone 4s. Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: Worked right out of the box
Reviews.Author: E. A. Clark
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews of this Stem iZon remote room monitor and have to say that it worked immediately after going through the update to the newer version of software.  I had been in the Apple store earlier and saw the newer model but after reading reviews it seems the only difference from the original was the software/firmware, which immediately updates on installation.  I paid half price for the older version on Amazon and essentially got two new models for the price of one after the updates, which are free.I like the functionality using my iPhone as well as the fact that it is not streaming unless you activate it remotely, which is the only thing I wanted it for which is to be able to see my home and lake retreat to be sure all is well when no one is home.  Other cameras seemed to eat my bandwidth for my satellite internet at our cabin while we were away and with this iZon camera I can simply log on when I want, take a look and then shut it down.I'll probably order a couple more for outside use too.

Reviews.Title: Love these cameras
Reviews.Author: dago2
Reviews.Content: These cameras are great for areas that you want to keep an eye on when away. The best feature about these are that when a room is entered, an alert is sent with 30sec footage taken. Very user friendly and easy to set up. Easy to maintain and switch if needed. Also...customer support is AMAZING.  Highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Very inconstant
Reviews.Author: Scott Brock
Reviews.Content: I've had nothing but bad luck with this product, it loses WIFI signals all the time.  It will work fine for a couple of days and then for no reason it just disconnects from my router.  I've installed other WIFI cameras and never had this problem.  Very limited product, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Horrible customer service
Reviews.Author: A. Percival
Reviews.Content: Should have ignored the one review about how talking to customer service it worked fine... Emailed them first and got a standard email response, but since I was going on vacation at the end of the week, emailed again asking them to call... A few days later they called, while I was in Miami airport. Explained I was already enroute but asked them to call back the following Saturday and he said He would. Well it's now 2 weeks later and still no call... And I am usually very good at hooking up my own electronics....

Reviews.Title: Disappointing - very challenging to get working...
Reviews.Author: Dale Stubblefield
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get an iZON camera as a friend of mine has one and it works great for him.  I followed all of the instructions.  I do not have odd characters in my SSID for my network and I am using 802.11n, which is recommended right on the box.  I'm also using WPA2 instead of WEP, which is what is recommended on the box.Well... after wasting at least an hour of my time, the camera still does not work.  It lets me connect to the "STEM" network that it creates, says it's configured, and then acts like it is "registering" indefinitely.This is unacceptable as now I have a very expensive paperweight.  I would not recommend this version of the camera.  They seem to have a 2.0 version that will probalby work better, but I'm not sure I feel like wasting my money again to find out.UPDATE: After rebooting several times more, the camera finally decided to "register" correctly.  I've upped my review from one start to two since it appears to look like it wants to function correctly.  It found that it needed a firmware updated and is currently updating.  We'll see if it makes it through this process.UPDATE: The camera never came back online after it tried to update the firmware.  I ended up having to push a paperclip in the back to reset it and start the process all over again.  This time it took about 15 minutes to update the firmware and after that the camera finally started working.  It's great now that it's up and running, but was kind of a nightmare to set up.

Reviews.Title: A bit difficult to setup but works great
Reviews.Author: John G. Svinos "Harleydude"
Reviews.Content: This security camera works very well and the iPhone App works great. However, I had quite a bit of trouble setting it up. It took several tries and the company's technical support help to finally get it to work. Now that it is working it's a pleasure to use. The camera senses motion or sound and alerts you via the App. It also records the event and let's you watch it. You can also see what the camera sees on your phone. Great for security and pet or baby monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Trash!
Reviews.Author: CHOPDOG
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money like I did, buy something else, anything else. I have tried to make this work over the last week with no luck. Called the customer service number listed on the app, only to find out its just a voicemail - awesome. Screw you Stem.

Reviews.Title: NOT DETECTING THE CAMERA?? READ BELOW.
Reviews.Author: Kyle Loveland
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift. It seemed like a good price and the camera is nice looking.  I plugged the camera into a wall outlet and was not able to get the damn thing to be detected by my ipad 2 or Iphone 5.  After a couple of frustrating hours, I gave up.  I called the support line 2 or 3 times and got the same recorded message.  I don't think there even is a person there to answer...Anywho, I finally plugged the camera into the USB port on my laptop (rather than supplying power via the wall plug) and viola!  It was detectable immediately.  Nowhere in the instructions does it say this is necessary, but give it a try if you are having the same problem I was.  Not a super crisp image.. I but OK I guess.

Reviews.Title: Great Product! (Judge for yourself)
Reviews.Author: Matt & Kiah
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were looking for an inexpensive video monitor for our new born baby. I searched high and low with very little luck on a good inexpensive camera. I came across this product in target for $38.18, I urgently searched the best place in the world for reviews, amazon. With very little stars for this product, I quickly became discouraged, but with that price I really didn't have much to lose. I decided to purchase the product and I am very pleased by the product it works very well. I would pay more for this product it's absolutely worth it.Pros-Took 15 min to set up and update firmware-great looking product-comes with very long powercord-easy to use, iphone app easy to use and setup-audio sounds good-great price!!-magnetic mounting systemCons-slight delay

Reviews.Title: Good product, just one flaw...
Reviews.Author: GeoCrass
Reviews.Content: Great Design, modern, lighweight. Setup was EASY, Actually easiest than any other wireless peripheral setup i have ever made. Might sound hard to believe especially after reading some other reviews... What can i say... it was easy for me.Works well in well lit environment. Low light image is acceptable.stem connect app for ios has some interesting features like motion and sound activation.Now for the bad news... While on 3g, you can only get 5 minutes of view (not really understand why this happens..). However, what really takes the joy out of this product is the terribly high LAAAAAAAAG which reaches 20 sec (something very uncommon with other wireless cameras that i have tried, irrespective of bandwidth.The first times that I tested it I thought for a moment that I was wearing an invisibility cloak :-)If you require "real time" feed, you will not get that with the izone (hopefully in another version?). Was planing to setup a grid of izones for security reason, however at this point i am reconsidering. In a nut shell I would say that it is a good product, and it is a pity that STEM has not worked around this rather serious flaw.

Reviews.Title: Works beautifully!
Reviews.Author: NachoMama
Reviews.Content: This item works great!  If I could change one thing, I would allow it to take longer videos to save on YouTube.  Each video is like 15 seconds long so I end up with like 200 videos in a short period of time.  The room that I have the camera in has very high ceilings to the audio is not very good either but the visual is great.  It has really served its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: does the trick
Reviews.Author: audio driver
Reviews.Content: This product works great for me!  It was pretty straight-forward to set up and I've been able to access the video almost everywhere that I've had a wi-fi connection for my iPad.  The only times that I haven't been able to access is when I'm connected to a public wi-fi (e.g. Starbucks) that has a lot of traffic or generally low bandwidth.It gives me what I want at a very attractive price

Reviews.Title: Avoid it
Reviews.Author: G. Ware Cornell Jr. "anotherlawyer"
Reviews.Content: If you have a remote room monitor that allows you to monitor a room while you are in your own home only, what is the point? The whole purpose is to be able to remotely observe what is going on.  This product is supposed to allow access from your iPad or iPhone through WiFi, 3G or 4G connections. The only problem is it does not work. With superb WiFi speeds from my home and then from my office, I would expect a video to pop it quickly. It never did.The only video I ever saw that was broadcast to another room in my home was below average as well. It was grainy under artificial light. There was a time delay of about ten seconds. If it had delivered similar performance from my office, I might have rated it a three. It didn't and a one is all it deserves.

Reviews.Title: don't buy this!
Reviews.Author: toto
Reviews.Content: The camera works, but the video quality is badThe software sucks:- login to user account takes sometimes hours or fails- watching recorded videos takes terrible long time or fails- downloading or sharing recorded videos is not possible.I deeply regret that I bought this rubbish and overpriced camera with a terrible retarded softwareThere are so many other cameras on the market doing the same but much better.

Reviews.Title: Nice start. No support when needed.
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Govier
Reviews.Content: Bought this at the Apple store for home security. Worked intermittently once set up due to the bandwidth requirement. Less than a year later I could no longer get it to work. No customer support response to my several inquiries.

Reviews.Title: hate camera
Reviews.Author: Randy Anderson
Reviews.Content: it did not work if you are reading this i would not git it if you you dont have wifi it will not work when i tryed to send it back they did not put mouny back in my account

Reviews.Title: World wide surveillance
Reviews.Author: Joel C. Hart
Reviews.Content: The Stem I-zon cameras I own are all over the world. I monitor my rental units in Puerto VAllarta. Mostly check entering people and leaving the premises. The alerts are perfect to check if cleaning crews come and go as they are supposed to. The camera is easy to set up, it is quite sensitive, a storm or lightning will set it of and you get an alert. the video is a little slow but works for what I need. The power goes of every once in a while at the apartments, but the camera re-sets and sends  the video without any problem. As long as you have WI_FI the camera works. Very easy set up and the magnetic base is perfect for angles etc. I monitor entrance and exit only, I dont have hi speed wi-fi so the image is a little slow. I have set the cameras up in five minutes. All videos come to my I-pad. This product is very good and I imagine it will only get better with new technology. never had to call fro help and I am not a tech guy.

Reviews.Title: Poor Product
Reviews.Author: Sad
Reviews.Content: Bought two cameras to set up in the house to view my dog while I was away.Could not even get them to connect with my wireless network. Called support and this was of no use.Asked to return them-  said I could try but unsure how to do it and no refund could be made.Packaged them up and sent them back.  I have not heard from the company at all since then.  No idea if they were received.It was like throwing away $100.00 plus my shipping back to them.  (three months ago)

Reviews.Title: Worth!
Reviews.Author: Rafael Paschoal
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a remote camera to check your room this is a great device! You can turn on/off the alerts trough your Iphone, Ipad from a long distance! The motion and noise detection are very sensitive. Unfortunately, you are allowed to just record 25 movies per day.

Reviews.Title: Good but....
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: S! L! O! W! Not that slow but 5-10 seconds delay. When my daughter was trying to get out of a crib, I ran to a room and she already walk toward a door to see me. If it has real time video, I'll not return this product.

Reviews.Title: Stem IZON IOS WRM-WA0-00 Remote Room Monitor
Reviews.Author: Dagmar
Reviews.Content: This is a fun little camera that wifi's to my iPhone 5 and iPad 3.When there is movement the camera sends a movie to the device.It has nice resolution (not hd).  I point it out my front door.So if I am gone and a package is delivered I will see the occurrence.But in so doing, I get the neighbor walking by or the car that passesin the viewing area.  It has settings for levels of sensitivity and sound.I love gadgets so the cost of$80 was affordable.

Reviews.Title: Nice idea but...
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey P Koskulics
Reviews.Content: In order for the camera to be useful, it must connect to your wireless network. It needs to be programmed with the network name and password. The only way to accomplish this is to enter this information into the IZON software on your iphone or ipad. The IZON software encodes the network information in a "QR" code. In principle, the camera will scan this code when you place the QR code image 4 inches in front of the camera lens.I was able to successfully scan one code only once so far. It took 20 minutes on my first attempt. Once the camera scanned the QR code, it showed up on my account. I was able to watch video successfully and I was initially satisfied with the results.However, after about one week, an error message appeared when I would try to begin watching video. I reset the camera  and started attempts to have the camera read the QR code. After 30 minutes of repeated attempts, I gave up. So now, the camera is essentially junk!The QR reader on this camera works poorly compared with similar readers on my iphone. If the QR reader on the IZON worked at least as well, this would be a great way to program the camera. Barring that, it would be better to program it through the USB cable. Without a reliable method of programming, I cannot recommend this device.

Reviews.Title: Not a good product for this price
Reviews.Author: charlie12345
Reviews.Content: The IZON camera is a good idea poorly implemented. If you are going to pay $100 for a single camera it should be reliable and not limit your video uploads. I have tried using this camera several times and never have trouble getting it set up, but once I try to use it when not in the house it doesn't work consistently. Takes about 10 min just to load the live feed, and sometimes never does. Also, VERY poor in low light settings.This camera should cost $50 or less for what it is until they fix all the bugs in the software and allow unlimited video uploads per day. Or better yet, charge $50 for the camera, and then $5/month  if you want unlimited video uploads.

Reviews.Title: not that bad....
Reviews.Author: JMB "Rockin in the Free World"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Target for the same price, plus tax. It was an impulse buy really, but I have wanted a "nanny cam" type security camera for my apartment for a long time. Not that I need it, more to appease my innate paranoia or delusions of grandeur - why would someone want to snoop around my place anyway? I bought this irregardless of the negative reviews (checked by scanning the bar code in store) but with Targets 45 day return policy I figured I could return it if it was a POS. Got it home, followed the instructions, mine linked easily to my home network. It wanted to update its Firmware right away from 1.0 to 1.3. That was more difficult, and after 3 failed attempts I googled it, found some pages on the web where others had the same problems, and where the creators answered back- disconnect from power supply, quit all apps running on the iPhone and reboot, plug iZon back in, and try again. That did it. easy peasy. Its now set up and giving me all sorts of YouTube alerts that it's recorded. Its still always me putzing around my place, but when I go out of town I'll leave it hidden and I'll be able to view it live if I'm in an area with WiFi or a good network, and also be able to view the recorded YouTube videos at my viewing leisure. It seems to do what it says, and do it reasonably well. It's nice that it has its own app, set up for me was easy, trouble shooting was easy, and it's small and will be easy to hide/ conceal. The chick (with a crush on me) coming to feed my cat better not rub one out in my bed, or I'll catch it all on video...ha!

Reviews.Author: shopper
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product through a seller on eBay.  I should have read his ad better because I can't return the product back to him!! This thing is a piece of junk and "technical support," is just this guy sitting at his computer readings a promt as to how he can help you set up your system.  This is not real technical support. Reviews.Title: Works well after getting through the details... plenty of room for improvement
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult time getting this camera setup. I imagined that being an i-device accessory, it would be simple and easy. I would not recommend this to anyone without some tech help on your WiFi setup. I purchased 3: 1 for security monitoring and 2 as a nanny cam. You should allow plenty of time to setup but you may want to verify your WiFi settings before starting. Otherwise, you will waste time and be frustrated. It took me several days to get the account setup because my email was treating the response for the setup code as spam (my spam blocker sends me a weekly message so I do not see my spam for days).The process for setting up is cumbersome. (1) Setup and account; (2) Ensure the WiFi settings are WPA (not WEP);(3) Set the camera to recognize the local WiFi; (4) Wait for the camera to register with the STEM network. Done. Good. But it took at least a couple of hours. Once one camera is setup, the next seemed easy. Also, once one phone or i-device is setup, it is just a matter of logging on from the other device. I have a iPhone 4S and an iPad, and my wife has an iPhone 4. It works well on all devices nicely including on 3G as long as the signal is good.The picture is nicer on the high-resolution iPhone 4 (and 4S) - small but nice. The iPad is a bit grainy but its nice to have an alternate device.I have not yet been able to setup the YouTube recording. I am almost ready to give up but I will try again. It's not clear what needs to happen other than give Stem your email address and password (this is scary). I setup a dummy account to avoid the risk of their servers being compromised and my email and password falling into the hands of wrongdoers.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Debbie Wright
Reviews.Content: Out of the package, download the app, up and running in less than 10 minutes. I am able to check my house from anywhere with a wireless signal. Picture quality is in color and very good. I use one camera but it is capable of using several. I highly recommend. This price was less than half of what they wanted at Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Bad Product - poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Cheddar toes?
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with high hopes, setup was easy but i experienced several problems with the camera and will be returning it.  The app is very sluggish, it freezes, won't log you in and when you are in it says your camera is offline.  I was using the camera to monitor a store room door for access.  Within a couple of days the camera stopped sending me alerts when the camera was triggered and didn't record the events for me to view.  A call to tech support was not helpful and all she told me to do was unplug the camera to reset it.  It worked for a few days and them stopped recording and pushing notifications.  I had an employee pickup and move the camera and it never recorded the event or sent me an alert.  I called tech support a second time and she tried to BS her way through the call and wouldn't listen to what i was saying.  At the end of the call i was so frustrated I asked that she delete my account as I was retiring the product.  Back to the drawing board but I would highly recommend you avoid this camera for anything security related as you can't trust when it will work.

Reviews.Title: Could not get it to work.
Reviews.Author: D. Goulian
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on CowBoom for a great price ($40), but they had nothing to do with the issues. In fact, they made it super easy to return it by providing a postage paid RMA label.The setup instructions sounded super easy. And it ALMOST worked - the camera quickly recognized the QR code on my iPhone, it connected with the STEM server, and one by one a checklist of items began to complete. It was on the last item in the list when the setup process failed. I don't recall what the error was, and once gone I never saw it again because I could never get that far again.For two hours I wrestled with the device, trying the very same steps over and over again. I carefully read the user manual to determine what the blinking lights were telling me. I tried the reset procedure numerous times but the device never again recognized the QR code. I turned off the firewall on my router and checked the encryption type. I turned off the overhead light thinking that glare was interfering with the QR code recognition. I'm a pretty savvy guy technically and I was determined to get this working.I poured over the STEM website looking for a hint or FAQ that would explain what I was doing wrong - very little info was found. It kept referring me back to the user manual, which was no help at all. I also Googled the web hoping to find other users who have run into this. Nothing.Then I noticed the support number and decided to get some help. It was 6:30PM in Arizona (MST). The support page says support hours are between M-F 7am-7pm MST. Awesome, I thought. Someone helpful at STEM support will pick up the phone and guide me past a ridiculous error I am making in the setup and I'll have this camera running in no time. But no, they went home early. I left a message for a callback. Callback never came. Then I tried to find some sort of firmware update on the website. Nothing. Not even an update link.That's when I printed the return authorization label from CowBoom, packed all back up, and sent it back. Two hours of my life wasted with nothing to show for it. Life is too short to struggle with poorly designed & poorly supported gadgets.

One had the plug broken off in the camera (obviously re-conditioned). It worked with one and not the other. 6 months later the 2nd one randomly started working. I would recommend paying full price for the new, updated versions.

But after that, I put it away and haven't used it since, for two reasons. One, it's a super creepy thing to own unless you have kids or dogs. Because if not, it's basically a spying tool, and that's really weird. Two, the base of it gets extremely hot when in use (or at least mine does). Made me think that eventually it could lead to some issues. But if you have kids or dogs and want to check on them, it works as it's supposed to!

Reviews.Content: I've had this product for a couple years, initially started with one, then added a couple more. Once I was able to download version 2 of the firmware, things got a lot easier. Still, the camera and iOS app leaves a lot to be desired. IZON needs to learn from NEST and from NETATMO.

Reviews.Title: Love the product, AWFUL customer service
Reviews.Author: E. Jones
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that once the product was finally set up, it is great.  Does exactly what it is supposed to do, and to be honest, I will probably buy a few more of these and hope they are easier to set-up than the first.I saw the negative reviews, and the only reason I went with this camera was the fact that a buddy of mine has the same one.  However, after trouble setting it up, he came over to help and he couldn't figure it out either.However, the customer service is what makes me give this product 1 star.  After doing every troubleshooting step in the manual and additional tips I read from other frustrated users online, I could not get this to show up on my phone.  I even made recommended changes to my wireless network, which required that I re-do every device that uses wireless, which, as you can imagine, was a major pain.  After trying everything in my power, I tried to contact customer service both by phone and email.  They say they will respond within 24 hours, but that is a joke.  When you call, it simply rings a few times and goes to voicemail.  This is the case whether you call at the beginning or end of business hours or anywhere in between.  Trust me, I tried calling all day.  I left messages and sent emails on Jan 6, 7, and 8, and finally heard back on email on the 8th despite asking for a call back in both my emails and voicemails.  Then it turns out that the problem was that the registration didn't complete with their servers, which they were able to fin right away.  This was very frustrating because I spent several hours over 3 days trying to figure this out, and it turns out the error was at their end and was an easy fix.Anyway, this company has a great product, which I will probably buy more of, but they need to add a few more people to work the phones and reply to emails, because waiting 3 days for a response is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Izon a must have camera!
Reviews.Author: amy
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these this past spring from Best Buy for slightly more money than you can get it for on Amazon.  First, the YouTube set up was very difficult and cumbersome.  But, now, that is fixed as IZon now has their own cloud to store your video on, that is not an issue.  I purchased this for my apartment to see if my neighbors enter my unit when I am not home (they have a key for security reasons but were told not to enter unless I asked them to as I am disabled and sometimes need help in the night and needed someone in my building to have a key for that reason only).  I can view my entire living room and kitchen (which overlooks the main door into my place).  It is very easy to set up, even someone lacking the technological aspect of such things can do it.  The quality of the viewing on my iPhone is phenomenal.  I have been in Arizona viewing my apartment in Minnesota without much delay in viewing.  I love this camera as I can now go down and do my laundry and leave my dogs in the apartment and yet know that they are in the apartment and not wondering the halls (my service dog loves to tug my door open and let his little sister wonder the halls when I am not home).  I can also monitor to see if my caretaker enters my apartment without my permission.  I also love that if my PCA's start to give me grief, I can hit a button and record their actions without their knowledge to show to my nurse to get proper action taken.  It is also a piece of mind for my family, I have given them access to view the camera any time they want to check on me or see how my aids are doing with me.  The possibilities with this camera are endless.  And, at the relatively cheap price, you cannot beat it.  A lot of things I have bought to try and make my life easier have been a waste of money, but not this!  I love mine and cannot imagine living without it now.  I think that for people with loved ones that require personal care attendants, this is a must to know that your loved one is being cared for in a proper manor, or for those parents with a baby sitter, this is also a must.  Imagine sitting down for a romantic meal and being able to check in on the baby sitter to be sure they are treating your kids well?  What a piece of mind that would be all at an affordable price.  Not to mention having 5 minutes of video recorded of a thief that has broken into your home!  And, it is so small, it can literally be hidden anywhere easily.  Mine is set on a shelf, and with white walls, you don't even know it is there!

Reviews.Content: received my izon camera today set it up in 10 min or so i thought.  The setup would not complete the Izon would not registeri waited and waited finally i reset the camera just like the troubleshooting guide saidstill nothing. and then the strangest thing happened my daughter saw what i was doingand asked was i using the old network password I promptly said what do you mean old password"mom changed the network password because she read , you should change all your passwords oftenlong story short i put in the new password and within 10 min my izon was up and running just like they said it wouldits been running all day i even drove to the local burger joint about 5 miles from my house just to see if it would stilltransmit and it does I guess i will buy at least one more for the price this is a good product. Reviews.Title: Simply doesn't work.  Setup is an absolute nightmare.
Reviews.Author: justsomeguy
Reviews.Content: I got this on woot dot com as a deal.  Lesson learned: read reviews on amazon before buying ANYTHING.  I only now just noticed how many terrible reviews this piece of garbage has.  I'll be brief:I own an iphone 4S, I have a new/fast wireless router at home, this should have been a piece of cake to setup.  It's not.  It's an absolute nightmare. In the end I got some completely generic and unhelpful error message saying "There was an error setting up your camera" or something like that.  No help.  No idea. This thing still won't setup correctly, and I just get a generic non-helpful error every time.  This thing is useless.

After that I needed to switch to the newer Stem Izon app to upgrade the firmware to 2.02. Since then its been working great.Before you give up on this camera make sure you upgrade the firmware.

Reviews.Title: Could not set up
Reviews.Author: M. Vega
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this from Amazon, it was on sale at Target and now I know why.  I spent all afternoon with this and still nothing.  I've tried connecting it to a WPA2 private SSID network that is connected to the internet then I tried connecting it to a wifi network with less security that is not connected the internet.  It will lock up and I have to turn off the ipad.  I am still going to try to get it to work but it really should not be this difficult and I am fairly well versed with technical systems so it seems to be some sort of compatibility issue.  Maybe if I create an additional open network it will work, but I don't want the video on an open network.  I will try with other devices to see if I can get around the error but so far I am not too impressed with this.  For the same price I could have bought a baby monitor that works easy and simple since that is what I intended to use the iZon for.

Reviews.Title: Stem Izon - the best
Reviews.Author: K. Hair "SML"
Reviews.Content: We own 3 STEM Izon cameras. If we did have any problems they were all user error. Our only complaints would be the white noise when looking at the video and would like to change the alert tone. Planning on contacting STEM customer service because they are always willing to make changes. Don't know what we did with out them.

Reviews.Title: No problems in setup, does the trick
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: I have seen several negative reviews about setting up these things but i am happy to report i had no issues at all. I ended up buying two of them. They both shipped with version 1.0 of the software, but I followed the directions and updated first to software version 1.3. Then to 2.0 using the "stem connect" app. All went smoothly. There are two apps "stem connect" which I used to update to 2.0 and "stem izon" which works with 2.0 as the viewing/ setup interface. As I write this iOS6 has been released only a few days ago and "stem izon" says it has an update in the works for the new OS but apart from a rare crash from the app it works as advertised. They no longer support youtube uploading but now have a free upload service that can record up to 25 30 second "events" in a day. If you dont save them then they get wiped out at midnight and you start fresh the next day. Once you have used up your allotment of 25 recordings, you still can get notifications that a sound or motion event happened, it just wont be automatically be recorded. Then you can always log in and look live remotely to see what might have caused the event. For my purposes it is ideal at an excellent price point. Also I have an extended network (two airports, one in bridge mode) and I have had no issues there.  The cameras were also a lot smaller than i thought they would be, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: New OS makes this a winner
Reviews.Author: Rob DC
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews and then had a friend who stated they updated the OS so it was near perfect. We decided to try it out since the price dropped from 120.  It was nearly plug and play.  It works perfect with the free iPhone app.  The picture is great.  Sound is clear.  About a 5 second delay to the phone.  There is not a way to check it from your computer or desktop that I found.  This is not a low light camera btw.  The magnetic base allows you to position it in many ways.  The iPhone app also allows you to set motion/sound and internet out notification options. Great puppy cam or regular light security cam.  I feel with the new OS I would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: Moderately challenging to set-up, but AMAZING once it is
Reviews.Author: Patter
Reviews.Content: Set-up was a little tricky. The first day i had to leave it because I was stuck. I emailed tech support and they were very helpful, even working on a Sunday, so i was able to get them up and running the next day. My suggestion: don't get frustrated if your attempts don't work. Just let tech support call you back or email you with suggestions.At first i was worried the issue was due to my AT&T; router: (only 802/11b/g not 802/11n as they suggested) and i had the router security set at WPA not WPA2. I spent time trying to change these AT&T; settings with no luck. However, these turned out to be fine.iZon tech support told me to reset the camera with a paperclip and try adding the monitor again to my network. After a few times of these attempts, the monitor worked! And then adding the 2nd one was easy.Totally worth the few hours it took to set up. I can now watch my house easily from my iPod. These have made life better and the technology is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: joe daee
Reviews.Content: No panning but the hardware update improved the connection big time.  Good steady cameras and viewing n the iPhone is easy.

Reviews.Title: Bad Product
Reviews.Author: Val D. Steed "Val D. Steed, CPA, MA, CITP"
Reviews.Content: I bought mine at the Apple Store not Amazon.  I should have bought it through Amazon so I would have looked at the reviews first.  The Apple Store has never sold me a bad product until now.  I wasted 6 hours on this device today before finally coming in here to look at reviews and I am not technically illiterate.  The product should have never left the barn.  Terrible configuration, very slow response on everything, and the firmware will not update.  I am packing mine back up tomorrow to return and give the folks at the Apple Store an earful.

Reviews.Title: Bug-ridden, difficult to set up
Reviews.Author: Ed Terpening
Reviews.Content: The camera just didn't work as advertised: the firmware update didn't work, YouTube integration, etc.  I'm surprised that the Apple Store sells such low quality products. I expect more from Apple.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: sarkis ohannessian
Reviews.Content: I must say that this is one of the best wireless cameras i have bought. Read about it and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Do  NOT attempt to use unless you set it up on WPA 2
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This is an OK product - I don't usually write reviews but it took me half a day to figure it out. (I like the challenge.) I just didn't want people to waste the time that I did.I was set up w/ WEP network security and it would not work. - As soon as I switched it to WPA 2 it was pretty simple to set up.The CONS:Will only work on Wifi - and not everywhere - I tried at work & it will not connect (Maybe not setup on WPA 2?)It also will NOT work in the dark. - no infrared.Last, there is a 20 second delay - it doesn't work in real time.Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Best to fix firmware and video flaws before a release
Reviews.Author: C Toth
Reviews.Content: Item was received yesterday where I promptly set the item up and registered it without a problem. The item was purchased for the sole purpose of uploading video if it detected motion and sound in my room. However; last night immediately following set-up, I received an email stating that the automatic video upload on YouTube has been disabled. The company said they are now working on a app of their own with a private video cloud to upload video and that it will be available sometime in the future. The item should never have been released without having it fully vetted. This tanks many start up companies.Callaway golf did the same thing with the Upro MX device last year, however, they offered quite the consolation package should you have wished to return the item to make up for any problems. Stem did not do such a thing here.My item is being returned. In addition, Sunday night the item was $127 and come Tuesday morning the item is $117.

Reviews.Title: A nightmare to set up
Reviews.Author: Steven Darien
Reviews.Content: I wish i had kept the receipt so i could return this.  I have not been able to get this working for weeks and in different place.  they keep promising improvements, but the do not come.

Reviews.Author: GD "g2dalmas"
Reviews.Content: Stem IZON IOS WRM-WA0-00 Remote Room MonitorAlthough I was able to get Camera to work it is not possible to upgrade software from v 1 to V 1.3 which is needed for most networks.Tried everything over a couple of days on BOTH iPads and iPhones, did reboots and log offs-on...got same error message 5 minutes into the upgrade each timeDo not buy...I will shortly return and should have listened to multiple negative reviews.

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: It doesn't work... I bought two cameras and received them very quickly but I stood hours trying to make it work! The camera never picks up the barcode on the application.. A waste of money for shore!...

Reviews.Title: Nothing a little super glue couldn't fix
Reviews.Author: Mytech
Reviews.Content: Got this for a great price.  I was a little upset that the bottom was broken off. However, I was able to superglue the bottom back on and since the electronics worked perfect!

Reviews.Content: Ya conocía este producto, compré uno hace aprox 3 meses en una tienda Apple y me gustó la manera tan facil de operarlo
