Reviews.Content: Got called, walked thru and still will not register.  Put it in do not use closet. Disgusted with all the do and trys

Reviews.Title: Great when it works, but...
Reviews.Author: D. Green "Semi-techie"
Reviews.Content: I bought the iZon when they first came out (direct from the Apple Store), after reading David Pogue's lukewarm review. I thought, "All the problems he mentions don't seem like they would be relevant to my use, so it should be OK."The iZon was easy to set up, and worked well out of the box. But then...To say it has been glitchy would be an understatement. It has suffered from frequent bugs, and each software update seems to introduce a new one for every one it fixes. I went through a phase where I filed customer support tickets with them, and at first got excellent support. However, the problems continued. When they ended their support for YouTube uploads, a whole new set of problems started. After a while I stopped seeing any notifications at all!What they really need are two settings: 1) Monitor only between these hours (or a do-not-disturb mode); and 2) A way to monitor, but disable uploads during certain time periods. I use my iZon to monitor my business, and do not need it to monitor during the day, when people are in the office. I only want it to monitor after-hours, for security. If is on during the day, I quickly exceed my video upload limit, and that does me no good.It's a great idea, but has ultimately proven useless for me. If you are using it for fun, or in a non-critical setting, it may be worth the money, but for any serious use, it is pretty much what David Pogue concluded: Far from ready for prime time. I give them two stars just to be reasonable... They don't really deserve even one.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Pete Boilard
Reviews.Content: Still doesn't work... Terrible customer service.. Don't waste your money.. Left a message for tech support and they never called back

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: J. Goodman "Gadget admirer"
Reviews.Content: This camera works as advertised.  My only complaint is that the firmware had to be updated before it could be set up, a process that took awhile.  Nonetheless, the camera works well and does what it is supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: Don't work in my iphone
Reviews.Author: gonzalo gomez corona
Reviews.Content: Finally After several attempts to connect the camera to my network my iphone found the camera, but in the moment of registering the camera ( stem app ) the registering process stops in the same place every time. I think that this product really is not that all that you can imagine.Be carefull in the buy !!!

Reviews.Title: Good Luck with iZON customer service
Reviews.Author: James Ware "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this product simply because of the iZON customer service.  When the camera works it is quirky at best.  When one of my three cameras wouldnt accept their iZON's own firmware update it froze and cannot be reset; basically useless.  Jonathan Mansito my customer service contact informs me without proof of purchase they cannot stand by their product despite the fact that my camera has only been registered under my iZON account.  I'm moving to the Dropcam for more cameras and when my other iZON cameras inevitably crap out I can be rid of iZON completely.

Reviews.Title: Only works on iOS devices
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: The box says "View and Listen from Anywhere".  It should say "iPhone or iPad required".  You can only access the video feed with an iPhone or iPad, while I was hoping to be able to use my Mac computer.  I wrote to them, and they quickly replied "they're working on a Mac App."  so we'll see what's down the road.

Reviews.Title: No Storage capability
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM WHITE
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 cameras (over $300 invested) thinking I could monitor my office and home while away.  Wrong.  As of 7/11/2012 They claimed unlimited You 'tube storage of events, however guess what? You Tube said no.  So what good is it if you cant view any past situations that triggered the camera?  Whats the point? You can set either sound or movement triggers but can't ever see what set it off. stupid!1. kind of a pain to set up2. can't watch it on your computer (have to use a phone)3. limited to 5 minutes viewing time then have to restart. It times out after 5 minutes. So why limit the viewing time?4. cant even view in real time because there is a 20 delay built in.Feel like I got scammed on a new productBill

Reviews.Title: 20 second delay, hooooray
Reviews.Author: fmp7 "willlynilly"
Reviews.Content: Bought this product from an apple store.  Really neat design, nice to have native iOS app, setup is a bit awkward and quirky, but no problem for anyone with some technical ability.Bottom line is that it works great, all except for the horrific 20 second delay.  The corporate website tries to tell you to check your network to make the delay better, but thats bollocks, and they'll tell you so after you prove to them your network is in great condition and professionally setup - thats when the support admits that it does have the delay and there's nothing that anyone can do about it.  Said that other manufacturers get around that delay by dropping audio or using mjpeg.  To date, i've yet to find a proper baby monitor camera without a delay.  I mean, whats the point, 20 second delay + baby = trouble.in the end, if you don't care about horrific 20 second delays, then sure, buy it.  Can't imagine what you need it for if you don't mind the delays though!

Reviews.Title: Think twice before buying
Reviews.Author: Peter Fisher "Peter Fisher"
Reviews.Content: I've just returned my second iZon camera to the vendor.I tried to install it without success... I asked for help from Stem support, tried everything suggested to no avail. I had a faulty camera.However, Stem refused to repair or replace it and referred me back to the vendor. I've returned it for credit.When the cameras work, they work well, BUT... from my experience, there is a HIGH chance that they just WILL NOT WORK. I have had problems with two cameras now. Stem replaced the first one, and the latest firmware upgrade appears to be working well.It's a shame.If I ran Stem, I would make sure that I fully supported every camera out there... I'd want to reclaim a good reputation by standing behind every product that I had made... BUT the company won't do this.Peter Fisher

Reviews.Title: Significantly improved quality w/ new software/firmware
Reviews.Author: Nathan1981
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this product early on, but am changing my review in light of new firmware and software recently debuted.While it is not full featured - you can find cameras with a lot more options - it is not designed to be.  It's designed to be simple, quick and easy for the average home user.  And with the new software, they've accomplished that pretty well.The firmware makes the video almost live, makes the camera much, much easier to set up, and is much more reliable in general when it comes to notifications/recording.The iphone app is about a 500% improvement.  The old one crashed constantly, could barely play video, and generally was confusing and poorly laid out.The new one is simple to use, has not crashed on me once, made setup for the iZon a snap, and generally leaves me with few complaints.My biggest issue w/ it is that it only uploads 25 videos a day, of about 20 seconds each, which is rather skimpy.  They are planning to launch some paid plans this fall that will allow for more uploads/etc, so I will be curious to see how expensive those are.If you want something simple, quick and relatively cheap that you can view from your iphone, this is a pretty good product.

Reviews.Title: Excrement
Reviews.Author: User
Reviews.Content: The software support for this product is seriously flawed both in setup and in usability. The product itself takes blurry, pixelated, and time delayed video of less than stellar quality. Took forever for the needed firmware update to download, be applied, and the system to restart. There's lots of delayed restarts with this thing. After doing the update then it was three hours of fiddling to get the thing sort of up and running. On an iPad the application needed to view the camera output is only viewable in portrait mode, is tiny, noisy, and, did I mention, that there's a 20 second delay before displaying onscreen? Motion and noise detection is mostly worthless. Didn't try the night mode as I ran out of patience and boxed it back up for return. Recommendation? Don't buy this thing. Buy something that works and actually has some level of support other than a web site you can leave email. If you have to contact support to get something working, you've got the wrong product.

Reviews.Title: Great idea but never worked
Reviews.Author: J. Williams MD
Reviews.Content: I bought this product when it first came on the market. I tried for several days with the help of customer support to get the product to work but never could. I tried it with different types of security with security turned off everything and could never get it set up. I have Mac computers and iPad 2 and an iPhone and this is not easy to set up. Very frustrating. Hopefully there has been improvement. I got refund.

Reviews.Title: Shows promise but not ready for prime-time
Reviews.Author: L. Baker
Reviews.Content: I have been using this unit for 4-5 days and it constantly crashes and now it is simply not working.  The unit is warm to the touch so I can tell that power is on, and I follow all of the instructions to a "T", but still not working.Bottom line: Wait for the second generation!

Reviews.Title: Very poor app - this will frustrate you to no end
Reviews.Author: John Kitchens "electronics and fitness fan"
Reviews.Content: One of the worst products I have ever purchased.  I picked this up at the Apple store on a whim (hence no chance to check reviews prior to purchase).  The Apple employee said "it was really easy to setup" and "worked great".  Unfortunately, the first is totally untrue and I can't get it to work to know about the second.  As others have mentioned, the problem is in the app.  After creating a user account a code is "sent" to your email to activate the app.  No code was ever sent.  After contacting customer support, the code was supplied.  Unfortunately the app then denied me login by saying that I had never created an account.  Customer support did not respond to this issue and instead continued to send me the activation code.  After creating a second account with another e-mail (and receiving another activation code - this time sent properly via the automated e-mail), I was able to link the camera to my home network.  The app then did not recognize the camera.  After 24 hours I could not logon to the app as my new account was now not recognized.  A terrible app makes this device frustrating and completely useless.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!  NOT READY FOR SALE! ( Updated )
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: ( Updated )  New Firmware!  Now worse than before!  Uuuuugh!  What is wrong with these people?This is a really neat idea and great concept at a great price!However, the software,  [ the app ], the camera firmware, is not ready for sale.  I hope you like restarting the equipment very day!  Constant disconnections!  You cannot really properly reach this camera via 3G and if you do, you are terribly compromised!You cannot install this version 1.0, [ which really should be version 0.1 ], in most typical WiFi setups.  Alpha character only passwords!  No Static IP, even though that is an option in the App!  No MAC Filtering!  So .. who runs wide a open DHCP only WiFi service today?  [ Well, not if you intend to keep anything private at all, right? ]And, certainly, we all know how terribly compromised YouTube private file uploads are right now, right?The author should be ashamed to have released a product like this before it was actually useable in the consumer world.Apple Stores should be ashamed to have it on the shelf!Besides all that, even more importantly, it's generally worthless hardware.Even when connected to a really good, security compromised, WiFi connection, very fast, very reliable, it has a 30 second delay before anything is available to hear or watch no matter what.  Which makes this device worthless as a Baby or Children's room monitor.  By the time you get the Alert, you will already know something has gone wrong!  If you get the Alert at all!  Hint! Hint!It is worthless as an outside camera under any conditions, for example, standing in the window on a typical overcast day, it's blind.Most of all, the motion blurring is so bad, it is overall generally worthless no matter what application you have in mind.Product returned!Very Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: it's JUNK:  it does not connect - and there is NO TECH SUPPORT available
Reviews.Author: Michael Dean Giamo
Reviews.Content: This iZON camera  - and the company STEM:CONNECT that makes it - is beyond FRUSTRATING. The .PDF manual for it (downloadable from their Website) is badly organized/written; is very contradictory in places to the iPhone-based instructions you get when you (finally) get the App to start-up and run......the instructions themselves are incomplete; and there is NO phone tech support from STEM:CONNECT at all...always a very bad sign...a small company CANNOT afford to NOT provide excellent phone support for their products: they will just die on the vine as soon as the buying public finds out they bought a buggy, difficult to configure, erratic in function product. NOTE: they never answered my call into their support line...and I was forced to leave a message and call-back number....they never called me back, of course....); and the only email I sent was responded to the next day: a request for help with the App - (which was a "Pandora's Box" from the start)  and the re sponsorial email had nothing but with USELESS information in it for me.Just getting the App "found" for download were so confusing because the instructions the STEM:CONNECT literature give are incomplete to the point of shame. At first, I figured I'd just download the App to my MacBook Pro 15 and then sync my iPhone to that laptop and get the App onto the phone. That didn't work. I could not even find the App when I did a search for it from my Mac on the App Store site. Following the very *non-specific* mini-"manual" that came with the cam in the plastic box, etc., and not finding the App where they breezily wrote "it would be;" after Googling for it with no useful results in my case....I called AppleCare and an Apple Care rep suggested I directly download the App to my iPhone - and then: there it was...except:After finally installing the App on my iPhone 4, and also had to set up a (new, second?) username, email, ZIP code and PWD to configure it to my home network, the App put up a message in RED TEXT stating, "WPA2 is the best security...." ....but it did NOT state that WPA2 is MANDATORY for the IZON to function and see the STEM network - which is REQUIRED to make this thing work - but I guessed I might have to switch to that type of security setting(s) instead of WEP (which is how Verizon set up my home network wireless/wired router for multiple Macs and PCs in Oct. 2011.....which I wasn't sure how to do - or if it was even possible). I called Verizon; they tried to help me switch over to WAP2...but the last step in that process failed to work: the set-up tool for my Verizon FiOS network needed a new/different password to finish the process and none could be gotten or provided. I even tried my original WEP password with the tech support Verizon guy still on the phone... and that didn't work either...so I'm back on WEP now, so at least I still have fast internet access...but still am here with no useable iZON at all.It HAS to be on a WPA2 secure network. Period. I know of no other solutions or work-arounds. I could find none.I will call VERIZON one more time in hopes of switching to WPA2 from the [unusable] WEP security protocols. If this next attempt does not result in a successful transfer-over on my home network to WAP2 security - and then hopefully get the iZON to turn on and function "as promised" by STEM:CONNECT - then back it goes to the Apple Store for an already-promised full refund.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but no connection
Reviews.Author: Dr. Robert Wm Shomer "RWS"
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced computer user and appreciated the ease of connection to my wireless network. However, after the initial connection for both my iPad and iPhone nothing I could do was able to make it work, either on my wireless network or on 3G.

Reviews.Title: Bad Experience all around
Reviews.Author: Mark Carroll
Reviews.Content: Bought this with pretty low expectations directly from the Apple Store and they were met. The set up experience is fairly complicated especially when they add in the attachment of the wifi to the camera in order to complete the set up. I believe they also update the firmware are the same time. Got past all that and downloaded the app. I like the idea but the app coupled with the camera is a pretty poor experience with bugs and non intuitive operation. In addition much of the features are not clear or explained. Following my first 5 min of streaming the app crashed requiring me to force quit each time. have not gotten sound to work and have put the whole thing in my junk file, not even worth calling support. Makes me wonder how they got Apple to assort this thing. It must make apple look bad as well. next ....

Reviews.Title: STILL HAS BUGS
Reviews.Author: E. MIKULSKI "ED MIKULSKI"
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA WORKED FINE UNTIL A GLITCH DEVELOPED IN THE SOFTWARE, MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO LOG ON TO MY ACCOUNT. ALSO, THE ICONS ARE A BIT CONFUSING TO UNDERSTAND. I ENDED UP RETURNING IT. MAYBE WOULD BUY AGAIN IF THEY IMPROVE SOFTWARE.

Reviews.Title: Nice looking but poor performance
Reviews.Author: BW
Reviews.Content: This looked promising, design worthy of Apple but that is where it stops. The system around it, the need for YouTube [which did not work] and indifferent support  from icon has caused me to return it and look elsewhere. Do not waste your money or time!

Reviews.Title: Scam
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This product is a scam. It flat out does not work. Has potential but like I said, it literally does not work.

Reviews.Title: Good system, very buggy setup and app
Reviews.Author: NYWebGuy "nywebguy"
Reviews.Content: I have 2 iZon cameras.Setup took about an hour and a half. The ios app crashed several times - would not allow me login to my account, suddenly shut down - throughout the process. Restarting my iphone did not help. I had to uninstall/reinstall the app each time it fatally crashed.One note, you must have your wireless setup to run WAP2. You'll want to confirm this before you begin setup. Otherwise, you will also be stuck with an app that doesn't work (see above).Once setup, the system works ok. The motion detection is a bit unreliable, but I am easily able to access video feeds while away from home. The video/audio feeds are solid.All of the problems I experienced with setup could easily be solved with an update to the App.

Reviews.Title: Must reboot iPhone and IZON before every use
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Typical consumer grade network camera.  Easy setup, but you must have the most recent version of operating software on the iPhone to use the viewing application.  Once configured, it works once.  Leave the camera view and come back a few hours later, it doesn't work.  Reboot both the phone and the IZON camera, and it works.  Leave the camera for a few hours, and it doesn't.  Reboot and, well, you get the point...End game: I returned the camera for a full refund.In summary:  IZON is a decent attempt to offer a mega-pixel camera with a configuration-free iPhone application, but unfortunately this product falls well short of the mark.If you need a good IP camera at a good price, try Panasonic or Sony consumer grade solutions.  If you have a few more dollars to spend, I highly recommend Sony's IPELA camera line, or Panasonic's iPro camera line.  Although not the easiest to setup, because they are professional-grade security cameras and are intended for professional integrators with basic networking skills, they consistently work well and the resolution (especially in low light) is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Dont Waste Your Money!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lombo11
Reviews.Content: I bought two units. One for myself and one as a Christmas gift for my son. The box says...You. There. Simple. You better be there, its the only way you'll see anything. Plain and simple they do not work as described. The one I am using in my office set up just fine. However after an hour or so freezes up and is unavailable. It then has to be reset (time and time again). Obviously not good if you want to access it from a remote location. The one I bought for my son will not even set up for use. My I Pad, his I Pad, his I phone all find the Stem network but the set up program cannot find the Izon. All of the system requirements are met at both locations. I am not a computer geek but have bought enough gadgets to know whats good and what isn't. This is the worst product I ever bought associated with Apple in any way. Very dissapointing. From what I have now learned there are much better cameras on the market that work. Do your homework, avoid this product.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: red brown
Reviews.Content: I bought and returned it next day. Resolution is very low and video feed takes about 30 seconds to play on iOS devices. iOS app is also very crappy. I like it's design and concept so wish they come up with better solutions for future models.

Reviews.Title: this product doesn't work - don't buy it!!
Reviews.Author: Happier and Wiser Now
Reviews.Content: I bought two Stem iZon units and couldn't get either unit to work with my iPhone or iPad after more than 3 hours of trying over several months.  I downloaded their new 2.2.6 iPad/iPhone app and that didn't help either.  Their customer support seems to be only 24 hour later web email or the victim/customer leaving a voice mail message on their phone customer service line for a supposed 24 hour later callback.My iZon product experience has been the biggest waste of time I've ever run into into in a consumer product.  Tying to make an iZon work with an Apple iPad or iPhone has been insanely frustrating and a crazy-making experience. Today when I installed their new iPad app and tried the installation AGAIN, I was feeling guardedly optimistic.  This time the new Stem iPad app 2.2.6 let me set up the account (unlike the first go-around), the app actually found the iZon device (unlike the first go-around), and when I went to give it the password for my Apple WiFi network it wouldn't take the password objecting with a message that asked me to re-set my WPA2 Wifi password with on that only had alphas, numerics, or a period or a hyphen.  Since my WPA password contained both a # and a $ character, I dutifully reprogramed my WiFi with a different password without the offending # or $ characters.  With great anticipation, I went thru setup yet again, but when it looked like I'd finally successfully made through setup, when I went to save the setup, I got a message from the Stem server that said "there has been a provisioning problem, please try setup again".  Well I tried it two more times with the same failure.  I'm now scheduling a ceremonial lighter-fluid enhanced burning of my two inoperative Stem iZon units in my fire-pit.Perhaps I'll video it and put it on YouTube.Before you buy this piece of junk, ask yourself what would the probabilities be (if somebody bought two iZon units at different stores a month apart as I did),  of two iZon's not working out of the box?

Reviews.Title: Steve Jobs Must Be Spinning in His Grave..
Reviews.Author: Paul Camacho of Great Falls, VA
Reviews.Content: Although... based my reading of the other reviews,  the iZON motion sensor probably would fail to detect any evidence of said grave-spinning and such spinning would have to last for a period in excess of 15-30 seconds before registering with the iZON app..And even if the interrupted eternal slumber of Apple's late CEO were to be detected by the iZON's dubious motion/sound sensor, the iZON camera would likely fail to display any evidence of this, given the fact that the picture doesn't seem to show up unless the monitored area is well lit.. on that note, I hope you didn't purchase an iZON because you heard that burglary rates go up in the winter months due to diminished daylight..THE PROBLEM WITH THIS PRODUCT IS IN THE APP! Do not buy into this money trap, read my breakdown of their LEGAL DISCLAIMER and END USER AGREEMENT below..So let's take a stab at this!You are most likely to be either:a) A "Consumer Reports" subscribing, homework doing, purchase savvy Prosumer: Checking out product reviews before you buy huh? Well good for you!b) A flustered Apple Enthusiast: (see: [...])Looking for satisfaction in reading that your fellow enthusiasts share your disapproval? After all, how did this Windows-level hardware item find its way onto your Apple Temple's shelves and how could this "Stem:Connect" app not be working? I mean, that's why we all switched away from PCs right? We all hated those free "trial versions" of software that took up space on our hard drives and desktops with their limited functionality and rookie league performance! I mean, THAT'S WHY WE ALL GOT MACS RIGHT!?!?! IT WAS ALL JUST SUPPOSED TO WORK! OMG WHY ISN'T THIS WORKING!! OMG!!!!!)... and so on.c) A Stem employee or manager... let's be honest, you're one of the Drones.I am writing this review for each of you (Separately)To my Prosumers: Trust me when I tell you not to go with this product, but for the love of God make a decision on how to spend that money! Our economy depends on your confidence!!To my iHomies:I know, Right!? This is exactly like 9/11.To the good workers at Stem:Hang in there. Maybe your boss will sell one of his houses in order to hire a proper-sized staff for this project. I mean seriously, putting a product on Apple Store shelves before even having a proper customer service line in place? I swear, I would even settle for an Indian call center worker at this point.. Outsource, Crowdsource, whatever, just give me some real support. I shelled out $260 for two of these things and now their only as good as your free app.BTW, I leafed through the Stem END USER AGREEMENT for this App. Check out Section II, titled "SERVICE LEVELS AND UPGRADES." Here are some excerpts:Part A, Clause 1: "STANDARD. STEM Innovation provides a standard level of software functionality for all software for use with equipment. ("Standard Level")"Part A, Clause 2: "ENHANCED. For certain equipment, STEM Innovation may in the future also offer a higher level of software functionality ("Enhanced Level"). There may be a fee (as defined in SECTION VII ("FEES AND PAYMENT")) for such Enhanced Level Software, and your timely payment of such Fee shall be a condition upon your use of such software."So basically, Stem's business model involves giving their customers an initial sense of confidence by offering their hardware at a trusted retailer (in this case, Apple) and by promising the customer a free, easy to use app in exchange for a high upfront hardware cost (In my case, about $260 since I bought two of these). People spend their money but quickly find their "Standard Level" software app to be completely and utterly useless, thereby making their hardware purchase equally useless.Thankfully, it seems Stem is insinuating it will offer these people a way out of their receipt-losing damnation by granting them the opportunity to pay for the appropriate software needed desperately in order for their hardware to actually fulfill its intended purpose (btw this product doesn't have an intended purpose, according to the disclaimer on their website: "STEM DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF ACCURACY, NON-INFRINGEMENT, MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.")Sound familiar? Yup, same "Blame it on the third-party" BS as before. But of course, Apple's people know nothing about these quality issues right? Their attorneys are too busy suing Samsung and haven't gotten a chance to work with Stem on any potential problems... I'm sure.Mac is finally Microsoft! HEIL MACROSOFT!!
